title: Joseph-Armand Bombardier - Wikipedia
snippet: Joseph-Armand Bombardier (French: [ʒozɛf aʁmɑ̃ bɔ̃baʁdje]; April 16, 1907 – February 18, 1964) was a Canadian inventor and businessman who was the founder of Bombardier. His most famous invention was a snowmobile. Born in Valcourt, Quebec, Joseph-Armand Bombardier dabbled in mechanics ...

title: Joseph-Armand Bombardier | National Inventors Hall of Fame®
snippet: After attending Séminaire Saint-Charles-Borromée in Sherbrooke, Quebec, he opened his own machine shop in Valcourt in 1926. He understood the challenges of living in rural, isolated villages in winter, when the snow made unplowed roads impassable. Over the next decade Bombardier spent his spare time developing various motorized vehicles to travel on snow.
